twitch_info.title: I wanna Gaze at the Horizon - Any-Penalties% - WeirdChamp run (missed PB by 38.7 seconds)
twitch_info.description:
So, somehow I struggled on the final boss more than last time (took 17 minutes 36 seconds longer than last time to clear) and ended up being as surprised by the clear as the previous run. I have practiced the final boss a great deal, and typically beat them anywhere from 1-4 tries - and in a very long session, around 6-10 tries. In this attempt, I went way beyond that, and only had 7 attempts reach the stage 5 attack I believe, with only 2 of which reaching the final attack if I recall correctly.
I was given 2 weird attacks, a crescent, 2 diamond rushes and  2 trophies if I remember rightly. Either way it was one of the weird moving attacks and the trophy that I got through to the final attack (stage 8 attack), and much to my surprise the victory attempt was after clearing the trophy successfully.
The final boss did not let up with hard attacks in this run. This run is definitely a WeirdChamp run, as the trophy attack clear was what allowed me to miss my PB by so few seconds.
Stages 3-5 were poor (stage 5 pretty decent but not great by any means), stages 0-2 were actually good, stages 6-8 were great, with only one notable major mistake in stage 8 where I had attempted to correct the uncorrectable and wasted time instead of redoing the screen early.
This was truly the flipped, upside down run compared to my previous run. Either way, it's worth highlighting for the trophy clear attempt alone, and for comparing the good segments of both runs together
Sub 5 hours is definitely possible, and potentially even sub 4 hours (although unlikely).

message.body: I'll get a run out of stage 0 eventually
Just gotta get a run out of stage 0 first :D
very dicey jump at the best of times
and has to be done twice so
I like how Horizon has waiting times to interact with viewers
needed for a 6 hour run tbh
and has to be done twice xd
now you can talk me again

i don't wanna see that boss again xd, maybe i will have this stream all the time im gonna be in the computer, and sometimes im gonna be afk and other times only saying 1 or 2 messages, but im gonna be here supporting you in the run :>
hmm this world remembers me the genki with you black world
I'm calling mega time lsos here
top left save is a stupidly bad idea btw
why this is not puzzle PunOko
because basically frame perfect jump out
weird as fuck run so far
and that's what I was afraid of
we're definitely losing time on stage 4 split
is this really going to happen?
twitch has done that to me
timemachine 2 you require good quality on
I feel like I did something wrong here
see told you split will lsoe ltos of time
losing time on the run itself now
is to get a stupidly good stage 5
cause if I touch right wall
this run is going to be 5 hours again
and I don't even have the time of day to do another run
5 hour run is still possible tho
You can't save 5 min in 3 hours?
could be salvageable now you said that
If I don't spend 20 minutes on pre-final screen of stage 7
gotta lvoe completely forgetting the pathing
my speed strats work so well on this boss
I wasted 20 minutes here last time
done that one from memory btw
and that makes me A N G E RY
still recovering frmo last screen failure
Can still PB really hard though
But I'm not going to do the leehee jump
prayers in the chat for final boss tho
and now we just wait for hint to appear
I did go through the ding routein twice, right Nord? From shooting a spike twice.
I always question myself at this point
Because the hint box takes forever to pop up xD
Really underestimated the difficulty of this boss in a speedrun.
There's every chance this run won't clear
PB is almost certainly dead now
the dev NEEDS to make a speedrun version
with a checkpoint in this boss
I'd place the checkpiont at stage 5 atack myself
you seemed failed at the last keypick attack, how it survived
And yeah, that final attack doesn't actually count towards the boss
That final key landing doesn't actually do anything
In a run as long as this, the final boss is truly a disaster.
But I somehow did the trophy????
In this run everything was flipped upside down.
I did all the final stages well and early stages not so great.
Ngl though, the trophy attack is just as hard to get right as crescent.
is there any skip in the hard needle screen in stage 9
Yeah, my cup of tea skip split. You basically shoot the spike, wait until the dialogue is done, repeat one more time.
Then simply wait until the hint box appears in the middle.
Then press ESC once the hint box is fully loaded in
I wish the skip was faster.
The hard needle screen does have additional skips btw.
If you get past the leehee jump, some of the spikes can be simply shot away.
Sadly that's past the leehee jump.
I've yet to clear the leehee jump in practice, which is why I still use the 9 minute long skip.
It's a shame, but what can you do.
As for the final boss... Really surprised it took me so long.
Because in practice (even after a long session), I've been clearing the boss first or fourth try as of late.
after long running and brain work, it's hard to do precise jumps
it's also a good rest for the remaining part, so I prefer waiting and skip
While the wait is long, it does allow a break, which is good in such a long game.
Either way though. Glad I managed to clear in a run again :D
I really do like this hub introduction though.
I've used it a lot for practicing. ^^
Larf's actually not too hard of a boss in a speedrun. Since you have 3 hints, you only have to do one hard attack.
Chad can sometimes get rather close.
Even though the keys are pattern, same in final boss - it's easy to mess up.
Piece is Piece, you either get them down or you don't.
There's only a couple hard piece patterns.
But since you have to pay such close attention, and the hard ones require memorising spots on the screen to go to which are precise, it's not so easy.
Zepto, the stage 5 boss - is honestly fine. I don't have much to say about them. RNG can be bad, but they're generally fine.
The stage 4 boss Pano, was a complete nightmare in practice. It took a long time to get them down for speedruns.
Of all the bosses, Piece took me the longest to learn. But Zoid takes 2nd place.
Curcil, the stage 3 boss, is just RNG praying basically.
Can be extremely infuriating or easy.
The first two bosses are pattern, the first boss does have RNG for the falling attacks, but other than that it's the same every time.
So Miki and Kino are generally fine.

The most notable portions in stages for me are: The pacman screen (the stage 8 screen with the orbs covering the entire screen and the multiple ceiling block jumps), and the diamonds & gates screen (the pre-final screen of stage 7).
Honorable mention goes to the stage 5 "round and around" screen as I call it.
The one where you go round in a circle constantly.
Those are what I consider the main problem screens. Though, there are a couple problem screens in stage 3.
If there's any stage I despise in this game, it's stage 3.
I don't know why, but I just really don't like it.
.... Actually, I do know why. It's the fact everything's designed to go on specific timings but in a rather obnoxious manner.
Anyway, that's me done for tonight! Thanks for tuning in folks! :D
Hopefully next time I do a run, I'll be able to PB.
